result.execSummary:
The defendant Damontae N Hattix was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Complete a mental health assessment and follow recommendations, take all medications as prescribed.

Defendant must live w/mother and follow all her rules. House arrest until enrolled in high school program (may attend Turning Point Academy) full-time, may leave home with mother, then house arrest lifted and curfew set at 9pm, may be modified by mother and Agent. No contact with anyone outside the family unless individuals are approved by mother. Counseling, including Anger Management. Participate in a sports program, community based program or school program. . Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes:
BALANCE STAYED
5/12/15 - AMENDED TO LIFT BALANCE OF STAYED DAYS for completion of the Jail AODA program. Huber privileges not granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 5 years bifurcated sentence.

**CORRECTED 8/23/2018: To reflect 255 days of credit for time served.**

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain high school diploma. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Participate in Cognitive Thinking and Anger Management programs. Participate in Fatherhood Initiative and Racine Vocational Ministry programs once released. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of extended supervision. Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.
